bail.description: abort the test run early after a pre-determined number of test failures. By default Bun will run all tests and report all failures, but sometimes in CI environments it's preferable to terminate earlier to reduce CPU usage.

watch.description: to watch for changes and re-run tests.

preload.description: Bun test lifecycle hooks in separate files

timeout.description: specify a per-test timeout in milliseconds. If a test times out, it will be marked as failed. The default value is 5000.

rerun-each.description: run each test multiple times. This is useful for detecting flaky or non-deterministic test failures.

smol.description: In memory-constrained environments, use the smol flag to reduce memory usage at a cost to performance.

config.description: Config file to load bun from (e.g. -c bunfig.toml

bun.description: Force a script or package to use Bun.js instead of Node.js (via symlinking node)

tsConfig.description: Load tsconfig from path instead of cwd/tsconfig.json
